alert.note: Alert for Coconino (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 30 at 1:15PM MST until July 30 at 3:30PM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING FOR THE PIPELINE FIRE EAST REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 330 PM MST THIS AFTERNOON FOR COCONINO COUNTY... At 112 PM MST, gauge reports indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain over the Pipeline Fire East. Between 1 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is already occurring. Excessive rainfall will result in debris flow moving through the Pipeline Fire scar drainages. The debris flow can consist of rock, mud, vegetation and other loose materials. HAZARD...Life-threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding in and around the Pipeline Fire East. SOURCE...Gauges reported. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of areas in and around the Pipeline Fire East. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Wupatki Trails, Timberline, Hutchison Acres and Lockett Meadow Campground. FLASH FLOOD...GAUGE INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Flash flooding is occurring or imminent downstream of the Pipeline Fire scar, including Wupatki Trails, Fernwood, Hutchinson Acres, Macann Estates and Doney Park. Shelter in place until the waters recede. Stay out of flood waters!
